page.title: 01ARUNDEL AND THE ARUN GAP
page.content: The area north of Arundel comprises, in equal parts, Arundel Park, admin- istered by the Norfolk Estate, and eastward, a deep valley through which winds the river Arun. The park, containing earthworks, and the site of a Romana British settlement affords excellent recreation for the public. Eastward of Arundel Park lies Offham and eastward again, across the valley, the village of Burpham, built along- side a famous Saxon fort. One kilometre north of Offham lies South Stoke and north of that, North Stoke. each village is accessible only by a narrow cul-de-sac road. Dotted across the landscape are isolated barns, farms and cow-sheds, with woods and copses visible from every angle. Wood- land, farmland, chalk-cuttings, river- side meadows and open downs offer vast unspoilt views of great beauty.
